title: Download all attachments function not working
content: Overnight my PC had a normal software update. Since then, when I click the arrow symbol to download all attachments, nothing happens. The only way to download attachments now is to click the magnifying glass, then save. For my work I need to download multiple attachments from multiple emails a day so it's pretty inconvenient.
creator: admin606

title: Suas configurações de privacidade estão bloqueando o carregamento dos jogos.
content:
https://www.ojogos.com.br/jogo/mahjong-link

Na tentativa de jogar pelo Mozilla Firefox aparece uma mensagem conforme o anexo. Foi autorizado uma exceção mesmo assim não foi possível jogar.

Mesmo autorizando no próprio jogo não foi possível jogar a tela não sai.
creator: eufaloserio

title: How to 'Clear' or 'Delete' Private Tab entries/items in the History 'Recently Closed Tabs' field.
content: Firefox claims does NOT save site/URL visit information while in Private Mode. And I thought that was true. However, I just discovered that Firefox DOES SAVE Private Mode URL/Site visits - in this specific place. I don't know how long the history will be saved - it looks like at least as long as the Window is open. I want to keep most of my open Private Tabs open - but want to Delete/Clear the ones I'm done with. I thought/understood that Private window/tab/visit info was not tracked/saved - and it's not saved in History, or Searchable. But it appears that this doesn't apply to the Recently Closed Tabs MenuItem. And there seems to be NO 'delete' or 'clear' option for this field. I can't find any reference to the subject in the Forum or Articles. The picture I've attached is NOT of the Recently Closed Tabs while in Private Browsing, but is the same MenuItem and field contents. Thanks for your interest. I'm hoping someone can help me figure out how to delete/clear this specific history.
creator: antiquetuck

title: Unable to full screen
content:
For a while now firefox has been unable to enter fullscreen when pressing F11. Instead all it does is move the "Scroll forwards", "Open a new tab", and "List all tabs" button over slightly (The buttons on the top right, next to the minimize and close buttons).

I don't know what's going on with firefox.

Firefox Version 142.0.1 (64-bit)
creator: brandonx777
